result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Pearson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

2 letters from Jaimee BL and Ejau H. filed by Defense

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 2. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 2: 
- 6 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 in 14CM1377 STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 in 14CM1377
- Court Costs of $243.00  to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:  Absolute sobriety if warranted.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling if deemed necessary.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jessica Klein appeared for attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Defendant Robert L Pearson did not appear.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date due to his client's child being sick. Court will give another date for sentencing this week.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. Parties request a different date for sentencing. Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint or the victim's residence.  The Defendant must appear at all court dates and must fully comply with his attorney.  Bail money previously posted to be returned to poster.

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the 2nd motion to modify bail filed by Attorney Kay.  Attorney Kay is requesting that the Court modify the bail to a lower cash bail.  The Court grants the motion and amends the cash bond to a signature bond in the amount of $1000.00.  All bail money to be returned to the poster.  Cooperate must fully and completely cooperate with Attorney Kay and must be appear at all court hearings.   All other conditions as previously ordered remain.
Motion hearing on December 1, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Second Motion to Modify Bail- submitted by Attorney Kay.
Hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a date in 30 days. Motion to modify bail will be filed in the felony file. Bail stands as fixed. The next date may also be used as a bail motion.  Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Robert L Pearson in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Jeremy P. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Defense presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Detective David V. from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense object and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defense presents bail motion arguments. State presents arguments. Court denied the motoin. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty Kay.
